items.content_html: My chicken sausage escarole soup came out so delicious that I‚Äôm thinking of posting my recipe. Do people still post recipes to their personal blogs? I originally did not want to start doing that again, but now I feel like I might as well.
What a clinic the Patriots ran against the Titans tonight. üèà
The Crayola Experience was‚Ä¶OK, I guess. My daughter said she liked it. The rest of the day was a lot more fun, I think.

It‚Äôs a road trip day for me and my family. Picking the driving music üéµ is the hardest part. We mostly stick to Laurie Berliner Band and Hamilton. I‚Äôd love it if we could branch out more from there.
In my 20s I only drank Manhattans straight up. Now, deep into my 30s, I prefer them on the rocks‚Äîbut only when homemade. It‚Äôs been quite a week for me and now it is time to unwind. Cheers!

Every few days I have to talk myself out of buying another pair of headphones. I don‚Äôt need the HifiMan HE-400i, and their sound leakage probably wouldn‚Äôt suit my listening needs at all, but I can‚Äôt stop thinking about adding an open-backed headphone to my meager collection.
The budget I was working on is complete, and soup I made on my lunch break is cooling in the kitchen. Phew! I am looking forward to the weekend.

I think it is really cool how many people are hacking away at projects to integrate their sites with micro.blog. I am happy, too, to have @manton handle hosting for me, so I can concentrate on writing.
I feel like I‚Äôve been editing and formatting this Excel budget spreadsheet since the beginning of time.

When I woke up today, the TestFlight version of the app I‚Äôve been working on all week didn‚Äôt work at all for some reason. Hastily, I rejected the Developer Build in iTunes Connect, so it wouldn‚Äôt go out to customers. Rebooting my iPhone reboot fixed all the problems, though.
